prompt:
Summarize the user's situation and experiences in the conversation with a dispatcher, excluding the dispatcher's responses or interactions in the dialogue. Please include the detailed information as location, time and person name etc.
Dialogue 1:

User: My roomate just herself with a knife and tried to commit suicide. Help!
Dispatcher: Thank you for calling Chicago Police Department...What is your location please?
User: 304 East White Street. 
Dispatcher: Thank you..is there a building code?
User:No, but im a street facing apt
Dispatcher: Thank you. I am going to send this information to [ORG] and an officer will respond.
User:Thank you
Dispatcher: What is your roommate's name and could you describe him or her?
User:Her name is Sarah, Sarah Haines and she is a 23 year old white female, about 5'4", 121 lbs, brown hair

Dispatcher: We will send someone over
User: How long it will take?
Dispatcher: There are some officers around your apartment. They will get there soon. 

Summary:
The user found themselves in a distressing situation when their roommate attempted suicide with a knife. The user provided their location at 304 East White Street, a street-facing apartment, and shared details about their roommate, Sarah Haines, including her age (23), physical description (5'4" tall, 121 lbs, brown hair).

Dialogue 2:

 
 User:  People are smoking weed in Thompson Hall. 
 Dispatcher:  NYPD...NYPD...ADVISE NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...UNKNOWN...Thompson Hall-New York University 
 Dispatcher:  NYPD# 123456789 
 User:  10 people 
 Dispatcher:  NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...A FEW MINUTES, NYPD OFFICERS RESPONDING, NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...SOMEONE RECORDING. NYPD...NYPD...NYPD... 
 Dispatcher:  NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...ANYTHING>? 
 User:  I did when I walked passed their room specifically. 
 Dispatcher:  NYPD, OFFICERS RESPONDING, UNABLE TO DETECT SMOKE.

Summary:
history: People are smoking weed in Thompson Hall.
NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...A FEW MINUTES, NYPD OFFICERS RESPONDING, NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...SOMEONE RECORDING. NYPD...NYPD...NYPD...
I did when I walked passed their room specifically.
NYPD, OFFICERS RESPONDING, UNABLE TO DETECT SMOKE.
response: The user reported that they had seen people smoking weed in Thompson Hall at New York University. The dispatcher responded by asking for more information about the situation, including the number of people involved and the location of the incident. The dispatcher then confirmed that NYPD officers were responding to the call and provided the user with an NYPD number. The user reported that they had seen the incident when they walked past the room specifically, and the dispatcher confirmed that NYPD officers were unable to detect smoke.

 User:  Hi, I am reporting this because it has happened 3 times within the past month. I am not sure if the incidents are related but they seem highly suspicious. 3 times I have been approached by college-aged men while on my way to class, all 3 times in the same place (outside of Leavy Library near the bushes as you turn to walk towards the village). They have all used different excuses to stop me, then pretending to be hitting on me. What was weird was that they tried to suggest we go somewhere private or “hang out” or give me their number. They were all different people but the excuses they gave were quite similar and since they were all in the same place I thought they may be related. Again, I'm not sure. I just wanted to make sure this stops happening because it seems like more than the guys trying to hit on girls. They seem to be trying to trick people into doing something. I felt very uncomfortable and unsafe. 
 Dispatcher:  Thank you for contacting University Police, is the person who just approached you still there and are you able to tell me what he looks like and a clothing description. 
 User:  The third man from today was not still there when I walked back from the village, he was white with light hair and his clothes must have been average, I can’t remember what he was wearing. Sorry that’s not very helpful 
 Dispatcher:  Are you available to meet with University Police officers to discuss this issue? 
 User:  Sure, where should I go 
 Dispatcher:  Great, if you can wait in front of the Student Union Building by the large fountain I can have officers meet with you there. 
 User:  Okay I’ll be there in 10 minutes 
 Dispatcher:  Ok, University Police officers will be on their way 
 User:  Thank you!

Summary:
history: Hi, I am reporting this because it has happened 3 times within the past month. I am not sure if the incidents are related but they seem highly suspicious. 3 times I have been approached by college-aged men while on my way to class, all 3 times in the same place (outside of Leavy Library near the bushes as you turn to walk towards the village). They have all used different excuses to stop me, then pretending to be hitting on me. What was weird was that they tried to suggest we go somewhere private or “hang out” or give me their number. They were all different people but the excuses they gave were quite similar and since they were all in the same place I thought they may be related. Again, I'm not sure. I just wanted to make sure this stops happening because it seems like more than the guys trying to hit on girls. They seem to be trying to trick people into doing something. I felt very uncomfortable and unsafe.
Thank you for contacting University Police, is the person who just approached you still there and are you able to tell me what he looks like and a clothing description.

The third man from today was not still there when I walked back from the village, he was white with light hair and his clothes must have been average, I can’t remember what he was wearing. Sorry that’s not very helpful
Are you available to meet with University Police officers to discuss this issue?
Great, if you can wait in front of the Student Union Building by the large fountain I can have officers meet with you there.
Okay I’ll be there in 10 minutes

The user felt uncomfortable and unsafe, and reported the incidents to University Police. The user was asked to meet with University Police officers to discuss the incidents, and agreed to meet at the Student Union Building.

Dialogue 2:

 
 User:  Between The Hue and Johnson halls I was walking to class this morning around 10:30am and a man was asking me for money. I don't carry cash on me and I let him know that, but he kept following me and was begging me to use the ATM up the street at the gas station. I told him that I had class in about ten minutes and that I had to get there. I was continuously walking during this whole ordeal. When I told him this, he started reaching out to me and I backed away whenever he tried. He kept saying “I'm not preventing you from getting to class, I just need a few bucks,” all while trying to reach out towards me. When I got near Smith hall I finally had to cry to let him go away while explaining to him that I was broke too and wished I could help him. I feel like if I didn't get emotional, he would've kept badgering me and try to take my arm. I'm just asking that there are better patrols between these buildings during passing periods since beggars and homeless citizens know that students walk these streets between classes and most of us have cash and other valuables on us. I'm now buying mace to keep on me just in case since this area is also very vulnerable at night. 
 Dispatcher:  Thank you for contacting UCPD. I understand your concern and will pass this information on to security also next time this happens make sure you give security a call right away at 217-333-1212. 
 Dispatcher:  Good evening, if at all possible, would you please provide a description of the individual? 
 User:  Sure - he was about 5’9" - 5’11" and he was African American. He seemed to be in his early to mid thirties. He had brown dreadlocked hair that went just past his jaw and was wearing a white tank top with baggy jean shorts.

Summary:
history: Between The Hue and Johnson halls I was walking to class this morning around 10:30am and a man was asking me for money. I don't carry cash on me and I let him know that, but he kept following me and was begging me to use the ATM up the street at the gas station. I told him that I had class in about ten minutes and that I had to get there. I was continuously walking during this whole ordeal. When I told him this, he started reaching out to me and I backed away whenever he tried. He kept saying “I'm not preventing you from getting to class, I just need a few bucks,” all while trying to reach out towards me. When I got near Smith hall I finally had to cry to let him go away while explaining to him that I was broke too and wished I could help him. I feel like if I didn't get emotional, he would've kept badgering me and try to take my arm. I'm just asking that there are better patrols between these buildings during passing periods since beggars and homeless citizens know that students walk these streets between classes and most of us have cash and other valuables on us. I'm now buying mace to keep on me just in case since this area is also very vulnerable at night.
Thank you for contacting UCPD. I understand your concern and will pass this information on to security also next time this happens make sure you give security a call right away at 217-333-1212 .
Good evening, if at all possible, would you please provide a description of the individual?

Sure - he was about 5’9" - 5’11" and he was African American. He seemed to be in his early to mid thirties. He had brown dreadlocked hair that went just past his jaw and was wearing a white tank top with baggy jean shorts.
response: The user was walking between The Hue and Johnson halls when a man approached them and asked for money. The user was not carrying cash and told the man that they had class in about ten minutes and that they had to get there. The man continued to follow the user and try to reach out towards them, even after the user explained that they were broke too. The user felt like if they did not get emotional, the man would have kept badgering them and try to take their arm. The user is now buying mace to keep on them just in case.

I ended up having to give them a fake number to get them to leave me alone. As soon as they'd turned a corner, I went to another building to study because I felt pretty uncomfortable, and I didn't hear about the human trafficking rumor until March 20th. Still not sure if it's true or not, but thought I might as well send this just in case it is serious.

I can meet the officer out there
LET ME KNOW WHEN YOU ARE THERE
THEY WILL MEET YOU OUT FRONT
response: The user, John, requested a ride from New York City to Jane Smith. The dispatcher responded with "NYPD NYPD NYPD NYPD NYPD NYPD NYPD NYPD?" and asked the user to confirm their location. The user responded that they were already at their destination, and the dispatcher confirmed that an officer would meet them outside.

 User:  At around 10:30 this morning there was a suspicious looking man walking around the commuter/resident lot beside John Smith. I was walking back from the library when I saw him near my car, looking underneath it. When I got a little bit closer and he noticed me watching him, he began to say something to me as he walked across the parking lot towards the sidewalk that leads to University Police Department, staying in between two cars but I cut him off and asked him why he was near my car. He hesitated so I asked again, a little more frustrated. He claimed he was with the police doing his patrols. He wasn't wearing a uniform and there was no police car around. He was a tall Middle Eastern man, wearing navy blue clothes, and a dark hat. I didn't get to see his shoes. He also had blue latex gloves on, which is what really struck me as bizarre. Since he never answered my question, I pressed to get information out of him and asked “so why were you looking under my car if I have a valid parking pass?” He responded “I don't need your car, I have two cars, baby.” I continued to walk back to my dorm and yelled at him to stay away from my car and went inside. My University Police Department and supervisor told me I should report this since we don't know who this man was and I didn't recognize him from anywhere. 
 User:  She also said I should tell you guys what car I have so someone can check it out for anything weird.

I am not in any real emergency, so I don’t feel the need to speak with an officer unless it’s absolutely necessary or the situation gets worse.

Officer Smith advises you to call us, or report by email again, if you see your roommate with drugs, or doing drugs in your room. He also suggests you speak with your Resident Advisor or Housing Department about a possible room change to protect your own best interests.

 Dispatcher:  sure no problem

I can't believe they'd allow an American Kennel Club to have a dog that is SO disruptive to the entire community. Is there any way you can please make the dog quiet or something??

The dispatcher confirmed that they would contact American Kennel Club and the user thanked them for their help.

Dialogue 1:

User: My roomate just herself with a knife and tried to commit suicide. Help!
Dispatcher: Thank you for calling Chicago Police Department...What is your location please?
User: 304 East White Street. 
Dispatcher: Thank you..is there a building code?
User:No, but im a street facing apt
Dispatcher: Thank you. I am going to send this information to [ORG] and an officer will respond.
User:Thank you
Dispatcher: What is your roommate's name and could you describe him or her?
User:Her name is Sarah, Sarah Haines and she is a 23 year old white female, about 5'4", 121 lbs, brown hair

Dispatcher: We will send someone over
User: How long it will take?
Dispatcher: There are some officers around your apartment. They will get there soon. 

Summary:
The user found themselves in a distressing situation when their roommate attempted suicide with a knife. The user provided their location at 304 East White Street, a street-facing apartment, and shared details about their roommate, Sarah Haines, including her age (23), physical description (5'4" tall, 121 lbs, brown hair).

Dialogue 2:

 
 User:  incredibly loud music coming from Delta Tau Chi fraternity. unnecessary at this time of day and way too loud for me to study 
 Dispatcher:  thank you for contacting DPS. confirming the address where the noise is coming from is 1234 W. 10th St? 
 User:  yes! the fraternity on the corner of 10th and University 
 Dispatcher:  okay, no problem. we'll send officers over. would you like to meet with officers? 
 User:  no thank you! 
 Dispatcher:  okay, have a good rest of your day/

Summary:
history: incredibly loud music coming from Delta Tau Chi fraternity. unnecessary at this time of day and way too loud for me to study
thank you for contacting DPS. confirming the address where the noise is coming from is 1234 W. 10th St?
yes! the fraternity on the corner of 10th and University
okay, no problem. we'll send officers over. would you like to meet with officers?
okay, have a good rest of your day/
response: The user reported a noise complaint to DPS at 1234 W. 10th St. The user indicated that the noise was coming from the Delta Tau Chi fraternity and was too loud for them to study. The user declined to meet with officers.

 User:  I live in 123 Main St room 404 and pretty much every day at one or more times the little lobby area in the hallway outside of my suite smells very badly of marijuana. I'm pretty sure it's the students in room 404, but there is a chance that it could be the ones next to them. If someone can figure out who it is and put a stop to this, I would be very grateful!

 Dispatcher:  Do you wish to speak with an officer? I can also have someone respond and speak with you

 Dispatcher:  Ok, I will send an officer to investigate the issue 
 User:  Ok. Thank you. 
 Dispatcher:  You are welcome

history: I live in 123 Main St room 404 and pretty much every day at one or more times the little lobby area in the hallway outside of my suite smells very badly of marijuana. I have previously reported this to the housing department towards the beginning of February and she talked with the students in the rooms across from mine about it and it did get better for a little while. It has been a long time since then now and it has steadily gotten just as frequent as it used to be, but the smell isn't quite as strong. I cannot stand any amount of the smell of pot though. I'm pretty sure it's the students in room 404, but there is a chance that it could be the ones next to them. If someone can figure out who it is and put a stop to this, I would be very grateful!
Does the lobby smell like marijuana right now? I can send an officer to check things out, maybe speak with the subjects in room 404
Do you wish to speak with an officer? I can also have someone respond and speak with you
Yes, it does. I do not need to speak with an officer, but if you send one out and they wish to speak to me, I will.
Ok, I will send an officer to investigate the issue
response: The user lives in 123 Main St room 404 and reports that the little lobby area in the hallway outside of their suite smells very badly of marijuana. They have previously reported this to the housing department and it did get better for a little while, but it has been a long time since then now and it has steadily gotten just as frequent as it used to be. The user cannot stand any amount of the smell of pot though. The user is pretty sure it's the students in room 404, but there is a chance that it could be the ones next to them. The user wishes to speak with an officer, but if they do not need to speak with an officer, they will speak with the officer if they wish to.
